name: Maududi
text: Sad, and by the Qur'an full of exhortation!

name: Maududi
text: Nay, but the unbelievers are steeped in arrogance and stubborn defiance.

name: Maududi
text: How many a nation did We destroy before them! (When they approached their doom) they cried out (for deliverance), but the time for deliverance was already past.

name: Maududi
text: They wondered that a warner had come to them from among themselves, and the deniers of the Truth said: “This is a sorcerer, and a big liar.

name: Maududi
text: Has he made the gods one single God? This is truly astounding.”

name: Maududi
text: And the elders among them went forth saying: “Go ahead and be steadfast in adhering to your deities. What is being said is with a design.”

name: Maududi
text: We have not heard this in the religious community close to our time. This is nothing but a fabrication.

name: Maududi
text: Has this Exhortation been sent down among us only to him, to the exclusion of all others?” Nay, they are in doubt regarding My Exhortation, and are saying all this because they have not yet had any taste of My chastisement.

name: Maududi
text: Do they possess the treasures of your Lord, the Most Mighty, the Great Bestower?

name: Maududi
text: Or do they possess the dominion of the heavens and the earth and of all that is in between them? If so, let them ascend the heights of the realm of causation and see!

name: Maududi
text: This is only a small army out of the several armies that will suffer defeat here.

name: Maududi
text: Before them the people of Noah, Ad, and Pharaoh of the tent-pegs gave the lie (to the Messengers)

name: Maududi
text: and so did Thamud and the people of Lot and the people of Aykah. These were all leagued together.

name: Maududi
text: Each of them gave the lie to Messengers and My decree of chastisement came upon them.

name: Maududi
text: They are waiting for nothing except a single Cry, after which there will be no second Cry.

name: Maududi
text: They say: “Our Lord, hasten to us our share (of chastisement) before the Day of Reckoning.”

name: Maududi
text: (O Prophet), bear with patience what they say, and call to mind Our servant David, who was endowed with great strength and who constantly turned (to Allah).

name: Maududi
text: With him We had subjected the mountains that they join him in celebrating Allah's glory, evening and morning,

name: Maududi
text: and the birds, too, in their flocks, and turn again and again to celebrating Allah's glory.

name: Maududi
text: And We strengthened his kingdom and endowed him with wisdom and decisive judgement.

name: Maududi
text: Has the story of the litigants reached you -- of those who entered his private chambers by climbing over the wall?

name: Maududi
text: As they came upon David -- and he was frightened of them -- they said: “Be not afraid. We are just two litigants: one of us has committed excess against the other. So judge rightly between us, and be not unjust; and guide us to the Right Way.

name: Maududi
text: Behold, this is my brother; he has ninety-nine ewes and I have only one ewe.” And yet he said: “Give her into my charge,” and he got the better of me in argument.

name: Maududi
text: David said: “He has certainly wronged you in seeking to add your ewe to his ewes; and indeed many who live together commit excesses, one to the other, except those that believe and act righteously; and they are but few.” (While so saying) David realized that it is We Who have put him to test; therefore, he sought the forgiveness of his Lord, and fell down, bowing and penitently turning (to Him).

name: Maududi
text: Thereupon We forgave him his shortcoming and indeed (an exalted position of) nearness awaits him, and an excellent resort.

name: Maududi
text: (We said to him): “O David, We have appointed you vicegerent on earth. Therefore, rule among people with justice and do not follow (your) desire lest it should lead you astray from Allah's Path. Allah's severe chastisement awaits those who stray away from Allah's Path, for they had forgotten the Day of Reckoning.

name: Maududi
text: We did not create this heaven and earth and all that lies between them in vain. That is the fancy of those who denied the Truth. So woe from the Fire to all who deny the Truth.

name: Maududi
text: Shall We then treat alike those that believe and act righteously and those that create mischief on earth? Or treat alike the God-fearing and the wicked?

name: Maududi
text: This is the Blessed Book that We have revealed to you, (O Muhammad), that people with understanding may reflect over its verses and those with understanding derive a lesson.

name: Maududi
text: We bestowed upon David (an illustrious son), Solomon. How excellent a servant (of Ours he was)! Indeed he constantly turned to Us in devotion.

name: Maududi
text: And when one evening well-trained and running horses of noble breed were brought to him

name: Maududi
text: he said: “Lo! I have come to love this wealth on account of the remembrance of my Lord.” And when the horses disappeared,

name: Maududi
text: (he ordered): “Bring these horses back to me,” and then he began to gently stroke their shanks and necks.

name: Maududi
text: Surely We put Solomon to the test and cast upon his throne a mere body. Thereupon he penitently turned (to Us).

name: Maududi
text: He said: “My Lord, forgive me and bestow upon me a kingdom such as none other after me will deserve. Surely You are the Bounteous Giver.”

name: Maududi
text: We subjected the wind to him, so that it blew gently at his bidding, wherever he directed it,

name: Maududi
text: and We also subjected the devils to him -- all kinds of builders and divers;

name: Maududi
text: and others that were bound with chains.

name: Maududi
text: “This is Our bestowal. So give or withhold as you wish without account.”

name: Maududi
text: Indeed an exalted position of nearness awaits him and an excellent resort.

name: Maududi
text: And remember Our servant Job: when he cried to his Lord: “Behold, Satan has afflicted me with much hardship and suffering.”

name: Maududi
text: (We commanded him): “Stamp your foot on earth, and here is cool water to wash with and to drink.”

name: Maududi
text: And We granted to him his family and also the like of them, as a mercy from Us, and as a reminder to people of understanding,

name: Maududi
text: (and We said to him): “Take in your hand a bundle of rushes and strike with it, and do not break your oath.” Indeed We found him steadfast. How excellent a servant (of Ours) he was. Indeed he constantly turned (to his Lord).

name: Maududi
text: And remember Our servants -- Abraham, Isaac and Jacob -- they were endowed with great strength and vision.

name: Maududi
text: Verily We exalted them in consideration of a sterling quality: their remembrance of the Abode of the Hereafter.

name: Maududi
text: In Our sight they are among the chosen and excellent ones.

name: Maududi
text: And remember Ishmael, Elisha, and Dhu al-Kifl. All were of the best.

name: Maududi
text: This was a remembrance. An excellent retreat awaits the God-fearing

name: Maududi
text: -- everlasting Gardens with gates wide open for them

name: Maududi
text: wherein they shall recline, wherein they shall ask for abundant fruit and drinks,

name: Maududi
text: and wherein there shall be with them well-matched, bashful mates.

name: Maududi
text: All this is what you are promised for the Day of Judgement.

name: Maududi
text: This is Our provision for you, never to end.

name: Maududi
text: All this (is for the God-fearing). But for the transgressors, an evil resort awaits them --

name: Maududi
text: Hell, where they will be roasted. An evil place to dwell!

name: Maududi
text: All this (is for them); so let them taste boiling water and pus,

name: Maududi
text: and other sufferings of the kind.

name: Maududi
text: (Observing their followers advancing to Hell they will say, among themselves: “This is a troop rushing in to you. There is no welcome for them. They are destined to roast in the Fire.”

name: Maududi
text: They will reply: “Rather, no welcome to you. (You will roast in Hell.) It is you who led us to this end. What an evil resort!”

name: Maududi
text: They will say: “Our Lord, give twofold punishment in the Fire to him who has led us to this.”

name: Maududi
text: They will say to one another: “But why do we not see those whom we considered him among the wicked?

name: Maududi
text: Is it that we mistakenly made fun of them; or have they disappeared from our sight?”

name: Maududi
text: Verily all this is true. This is how the inmates of the Fire will dispute among themselves.

name: Maududi
text: Tell them, (O Prophet): “I am nothing but a warner. There is no deity but Allah, the One, the Supreme,

name: Maududi
text: the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is in between them, the Most Mighty, the Most Forgiving.”

name: Maududi
text: Say: “This is a tiding of tremendous import

name: Maududi
text: from which you are turning away.”

name: Maududi
text: (Tell them): “I had no knowledge of the High Council when they were disputing.

name: Maududi
text: I am told (about matters) by means of revelation only because I am a clear warner.”

name: Maududi
text: When your Lord said to the angels: “Verily I am creating a human being from clay.

name: Maududi
text: After I have created him and breathed into him of My spirit, fall you down, prostrating yourselves to him.”

name: Maududi
text: Then the angels, all of them, prostrated themselves before Adam

name: Maududi
text: except Iblis. He waxed proud and became one of the unbelievers.

name: Maududi
text: The Lord said: “O Iblis, what prevented you from prostrating yourself before him whom I created of My Two Hands. Are you waxing proud, or fancy yourself to be too exalted?”

name: Maududi
text: He replied: “I am nobler than he. You created me from fire and created him from clay.”

name: Maududi
text: He said: “Get out of here; surely you are accursed,

name: Maududi
text: and My curse shall remain upon you till the Day of Resurrection.”

name: Maududi
text: Satan said: “My Lord, then grant me respite till the Day that they are raised up.”

name: Maududi
text: He said: “You are of those who have been granted respite

name: Maududi
text: till the Day whose Hour I know.”

name: Maududi
text: (Iblis) said: “By Your glory, I shall mislead them all

name: Maududi
text: except those of Your servants, the chosen ones from amongst them.”

name: Maududi
text: He (i.e. Allah) said: “This is the Truth -- and I only speak the Truth --

name: Maududi
text: I will certainly fill the Gehenna with you and with all those among them who follow you.”

name: Maududi
text: (O Prophet), tell them: “I do not ask you for any recompense for the performance of this task; nor am I given to affectation.

name: Maududi
text: This is nothing but an Admonition for all people the world over.

name: Maududi
text: You will know the truth of the matter after a while.”
